Quantified Commute

UX / MOBILE UI / DAAP

About the project

This project was an exploration of information architecture. My goal was to assemble a dataset, look for trends or interesting insights and then visualize it in an understandable and engaging way

Tracking every aspectâ€¨of my driving for 3 weeks

Each day this semester I commuted 21 miles to and from campus each day and it was a source of much stress and frustration. I decided to track this activity to see if there was any way to improve the experience.

I was able to use the sensors on an iphone to gather the data required to analyze my driving patterns.

GPS

Accelerometer

Gyroscope

Analyzing the data for trends

I used a variety of different graphing tools to look for trends in my data.

The most interesting insight was the immense amount of variation in commute duration based on my departure time
